Metadata: Coast & Sea magazine (Volume 3, No. 1, and No. 2 Winter/Spring and Summer 1994)
Two newsletter/maga​zine issues in one entry for 1994. From 1995 on, the document number changed to the type code O for a full magazine/period​ical. See: LSU-O-95-001, etc. for further issues.

Coast and Sea magazine provides marine and coastal research in Louisiana's Universities. The following topics are in these issues: V. 3, No. 1: . . . But what have you done for us lately? By Jack Van Lopik; Interactive Interns; Microcosms: Imitating Nature; Looking glass world on the sea floor; Peaceful coexistence: Oil spills and wildlife; Class notes for marine educators Modeling nature, by E. Abrams. V. 3, No. 2: The Coast and its People: Who are the people of Louisiana's coastal zone? by D.W. Davis; The human dimension of coastal and marine issues, by M.K. Orbach; Offshore Oil Drilling- Louisiana's Dream, California's nightmare; Wetland loss...as people see it; wetland loss...man and nature; University research - Reaching out to the community.
